tasks.task: Drive a tractor to move the combine out of the field
subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat of the tractor
Attach the combine to the tractor
Operate the tractor controls to move the combine
Navigate the tractor and combine through the field

tasks.task: Operate a grain auger to transfer harvested grain
subtasks: Align the auger housing to the grain box opening
Connect the auger to the tractor drawbar
Start the auger motor and adjust speed
Direct grain flow into the grain hauler or storage bin

tasks.task: Load the grain hauler with harvested grain
subtasks: Position the grain box or tank underneath the auger discharge
Open the grain box cleanout door or Auger housing flap
Monitor the grain level and offload when full

tasks.task: Drive the grain hauler to transport grain to storage
subtasks: Load the grain hauler onto a truck or directly to a bin
Secure the grain hauler to the truck if towing
Navigate the truck to the storage facility
Align the grain hauler with the unloader or bin intake

tasks.task: Sift the grain to remove debris and contaminants
subtasks: Set up the grain sieve or separator equipment
Direct grain flow through the sieve
Check for stick residues, stones, or other impurities
Collect and dispose of the separated contaminant material

tasks.task: Clean and maintain the grain sieve after use
subtasks: Unhook the sieve from the processing equipment
Remove residue from the sieve screens
Inspect the screens for wear or damage
Rinse the sieve with water or air and store properly

tasks.task: Pour grain into storage bins following proper procedures
subtasks: Manually open the bin unloader or chute
Monitor grain flow and adjust if necessary
Check for any bridging or airflow issues
Seal the bin unloader properly to prevent contamination

tasks.task: Remove inner plastic wrap from the combine auger after use
subtasks: Locate the protective plastic covering on the combine
Disengage the auger from the combine temporarily
Carefully remove the plastic wrap, ensuring not to damage the auger components
Reinstall the plastic wrap on the auger for next use

tasks.task: Check the steering system on equipment
subtasks: Inspect the steering linkage and connections on the combine
Check fluid levels in the steering system
Check for any loose or worn components
Lubricate or grease as necessary
Obtain a detailed map of the field with yield sensors
Input the combine model and implement information into the monitor
Perform tests using known weight values to set the monitor’s sensitivity

tasks.task: Manage the driving of the combine through the field with proper speed control
subtasks: Monitor the grain loss from the combine
Adjust the speed based on the work rate and losses
Avoid excessively high speeds to reduce chaff and loss

tasks.task: Clear remnants and weeds from the combine after harvesting
subtasks: Inspect the combine's fungides application and cleaning system
Check that all residue is expelled properly
Clean any clogged orifice areas to prevent buildup
Ensure that no residual matter remains in the combine for the next crop cycle

tasks.task: Disconnect the steering and power takeoff (PTO) from the combine
subtasks: Identify the correct disengagement procedure for the PTO
Power down the combine's engine if necessary
Disconnect the steering linkage
Remove any hoses or electrical connections

tasks.task: Cross the field with the combine using a four-wheel drive system
subtasks: Shift the combine into four-wheel drive mode
Operate the field hydraulics for optimal traction
Avoid going too slowly to maintain efficiency; balance speed with field conditions

tasks.task: Use the combine's cleaning system to remove debris from harvested grain
subtasks: Operate the combine's chaffer or cleaning shoe
Check that the chaffer is properly set to remove light fractions
Monitor grain quality entering the auger

tasks.task: Perform preliminary checks on the grain dryer after harvesting
subtasks: Review dryer operation logs for the previous season
Inspect the fuselage cooling system for damage
Check that all fans are operational and belts are tight

tasks.task: Inspect and adjust the steering linkage on the combine to ensure straight path movement
subtasks: Measure and align the steering components
Adjust the tension or slack as needed to correct turning radius
Test the straightness of the combine's path during field operation

tasks.task: Remove grain debris for proper disposal or use as livestock feed
subtasks: Gather the chaff, stalks, and other debris from the field
Have a suitable containment method (bales, spacings)
Spread the debris to dry or use directly as animal bedding or mulch
